page.title: 09CLIMPERWELL FARM
page.content: Climperwell Farm is one of the largest in the parish, although not all of the land actually lies within the parish boundary. In total there are some 500acres, of which some 300 acres is arable,producing mostly barley, wheat, oil-seed rape and in recent years peas as a protein crop. The rough grassland is used for store cattle,and ponies while the remaining 140 acres is woodland producing some fencing materials and in the last two seasons a pheasant shoot has been started on a syndicated basis, with some 2000 birds being bought in for release. The owner is Kieth Broadstock and he and one full-time worker run the farm with the help of casual workers during the busy times of harvest and planting.
